alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:12PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Garfield and southwestern Whitman Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 212 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pomeroy, or 18 miles northeast of Dayton, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomeroy and Dodge. This includes U.S. Highway 12 in Washington between mile markers 390 and 407. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains; Washington Palouse
